com.g6pay.sdk
Class UDID

java.lang.Object
  com.g6pay.sdk.UDID

public class UDID
extends java.lang.Object

Class providing information about the unique identifiers of a device.

Author:
"Peter Hsu"

Field Detail

UDID_HASH

public static final java.lang.String UDID_HASH
This is a hash on all the stuff to make sure things are unique per user per device..

See Also:
Constant Field Values

UDID_TELEPHONY_ID

public static final java.lang.String UDID_TELEPHONY_ID
This is available only on phone devices. Also know as the MEID. This is fairly available, but survives wipes and is a better measure of the device than the user. This also will not be available on the simulator

See Also:
Constant Field Values

UDID_ANDROID_ID

public static final java.lang.String UDID_ANDROID_ID
This is a 64-bit quantity that is generated and stored when the device first boots. It is reset when the device is wiped. There are downsides: First, it is not 100% reliable on releases of Android prior to 2.2 (“Froyo”). Also, there has been at least one widely-observed bug in a popular handset from a major manufacturer, where every instance has the same ANDROID_ID.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

UDID_SERIAL_NUMBER

public static final java.lang.String UDID_SERIAL_NUMBER
Since Android 2.3 (“Gingerbread”) this is available via android.os.Build.SERIAL. Devices without telephony are required to report a unique device ID here; some phones may do so also.

See Also:
